title: Person shot in head taken to hospital
content:
TWIN FALLS, Idaho (KMVT/KSVT) — Police are still investigating a shooting that sent one woman to the hospital Thursday evening.
The woman was shot in the head just before 5 p.m.
Police say they've made no arrests, and they could not confirm the severity of the woman's injuries.
They are not sure at this time if it was an accident. Police said there is no threat to the public.
They were unable to release much information because of the investigation.
Neighbors say the commotion was scary.
“Seeing all the cops outside I'm freaked out like what the heck is going on? Because this is Twin Falls. Stuff like that doesn't happen here,” said one female neighbor. “Then I found out what did happen and it freaked me out a little bit.”
Police would not release any more information at this time.
We'll update you as more information becomes available.
Original story:
Twin Falls Police are responding to a shooting outside an apartment complex on the 200 block of Second Avenue North in downtown Twin Falls.
The person who was reportedly shot in the head has been taken to a hospital. Police are still investigating and are unsure at this time if this was an accident.
The shooting was reported at 4:41 p.m. As of 5:15 p.m. no arrests had been made. According to a city spokesman, it’s too early to say if the public is in any danger.
KMVT will have more information when it becomes available.
